intro: Renealmia alticola, commonly known as the highland renealmia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup, often collecting water in its native habitat. Its inflorescence consists of a single, showy flower that can vary in color from white to pink. Renealmia alticola is adapted to grow in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
